Google Services Google Services operating income increased $1.8 billion from the three months ended June 30, 2022 to the three months ended June 30, 2023 and increased $1.6 billion from the six months ended June 30, 2022 to the six months ended June 30, 2023. Additionally, operating income benefited from a reduction in costs driven by the change in the estimated useful lives of our servers and certain network equipment. Operating Expenses (General and Administrative Expenses) for the last 3 fiscal years are as follows:

| Year | Operating Expenses (in millions) | Year-on-Year Change (%) |
|-------|---------------------------------|------------------------|
| 2021  | $13,510                         | -                      |
| 2022  | $15,724                         | +16.39%                |
| 2023  | $16,425                         | +4.46%                 |

This shows a consistent increase in operating expenses over the three years, with a significant rise from 2021 to 2022 and a slower growth rate from 2022 to 2023.

This indicates the company has been increasingly efficient in managing its cost of revenues relative to its total revenues.

final_answer:
The General and Administrative (G&A) expenses, a major part of operating expenses, for the last three fiscal years are as follows:

| Year | G&A Expenses (in millions) | Year-on-Year Change (in millions) | Percentage Change |
|-------|----------------------------|----------------------------------|-------------------|
| 2021  | $13,510                    | -                                | -                 |
| 2022  | $15,724                    | +$2,214                          | +16.39%           |
| 2023  | $16,425                    | +$701                            | +4.46%            |

- From 2021 to 2022, G&A expenses increased by $2,214 million, a 16.39% rise.
- From 2022 to 2023, G&A expenses increased by $701 million, a 4.46% rise.

This indicates a consistent increase in operating expenses over the last three years, with a slower growth rate in the most recent year, suggesting some stabilization or improved cost management.

Other Bets Other Bets operating loss decreased $78 million from the three months ended September 30, 2023 to the three months ended September 30, 2024, due to a combination of factors, none of which were individually significant. Other Bets operating loss increased $38 million from the nine months ended September 30, 2023 to the nine months ended September 30, 2024. The increase in operating loss was primarily due to an increase in expenses, largely driven by compensation expenses, partially offset by an increase in revenues. The increase in compensation expenses was primarily as a result of the reduction in valuation-based compensation liabilities related to certain Other Bets recognized in the prior year comparable period.
